sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SAVERNE, an arrondissement of the department of the Lower Rhine, in France. Its extent is 297,104 acres, equal to 464 square miles ; and is divided into seven cantons, and these into 165 communes, with a population, in the year 1836, of 112,260 persons. The capital, a city of the same name, stands on the river Zorn, at the foot of the Vosges Mountains, in one of the most luxuriant parts of ancient Alsace. It is antiquely built, and contains 5352 inhabitants, who generally speak the German language. Long. 7. 48. 21. E. Lat. 48. 44. 20. N.
